conclusion: The diaphragm is sealed initially, preventing gas leakage until the piston moves upwards.
The volume of the upper chamber increases by Ax, where A is the cross-sectional area.
The height of the lower chamber becomes -x, which doesn't make sense.
Redefining positions: initial diaphragm position at height H from the bottom.
The upper chamber expands adiabatically, causing its pressure to drop.
